programme.title: Politics in Rwanda
programme.short_synopsis: Opponents of the Rwandan government have come under attack in the run up to elections
programme.medium_synopsis: Next week Rwanda's President Paul Kagame is standing for re-election. But the run up to the vote has been overshadowed by a series of attacks on government opponents. Rob Walker investigates.
programme.long_synopsis:
Next week Rwanda's President Paul Kagame is standing for re-election. But the run up to the vote has been overshadowed by a series of attacks on government opponents. 

Rob Walker travels to Rwanda to investigate. Listeners may find some scenes in this programme disturbing.

supporting_content_items.title: Paul Kagame on The Interview
supporting_content_items.content: He is the man who has led Rwanda out of the genocide that took place 15 years ago. His priority has been to rebuild Rwanda and put the terrible ethnic divisions firmly in the past. President Paul Kagame talks to Owen Bennett Jones about the task he faces.
